In flight, if the Constant Speed Drive (CSD) temperature indicator is in the red arc the:

options.text: pilot must disconnect it, and the generator is not available for the rest of flight.
pilot can disconnect it to allow it to cool and use it again.
pilot must disconnect it and manually control the alternator.

variant.question: The calibration for the ASI is based on density
The airspeed indicator of a twin-engine aircraft comprises different sectors and colour marks. The blue line corresponds to the:

options.text: optimum climbing speed with one engine inoperative, or VYSE.
maximum speed in operations, or VMO.
speed not to be exceeded, or VNE.

variant.question: What is the most efficient way to deal with unreliable airspeed?

options.text: The pitch and power settings are the most efficient method, but flight crew can also refer to the GPS speed and the standby instruments indications.
The GPS speed can be used without any limitations.
Fly the aircraft in such a way that the unpleasant aerodynamic noise is not heard from the cockpit anymore.
The GPS speed and the comparison with the standby instruments take precedence over the pitch and power settings.

variant.question: During its descent through an ash cloud, the pitot probe becomes blocked. The airspeed indicator (ASI):
The airspeed indicator of an aircraft is provided with a moving red and white hatched pointer. This pointer indicates the:

options.text: maximum speed in VMO operation versus altitude.
maximum speed in VMO operation versus temperature.
speed indicated on the autothrottle control box versus temperature.
speed indicated on the autothrottle control box versus altitude.

variant.question: How is the reading of the Airspeed Indicator (ASI) affected when ice blocks the static air ports?

options.text: The Airspeed Indicator shows an increase in speed with a decrease in altitude.
The Airspeed Indicator no longer indicates any change in speed.
The Airspeed Indicator shows a decrease in speed with a decrease in altitude.
The on board emergency system switches automatically to the standby static pressure port.

Assuming that the CAS remains constant, if the total pressure probe is blocked, the IAS:

options.text: remains constant during level flight, increases during a climb and decreases during a descent.
remains constant during level flight, decreases during a climb and increases during a descent.
remains constant during all the phases of the flight.
increases during level flight, remains constant during a climb and a descent.

variant.question: The position error of an ASI results from

options.text: the effects of the airflow around the static vent and pitot head.
the fact that air becomes more compressible at high speeds.
the difference in air density from sea level ISA density.

variant.question: An airspeed indicator includes a capsule; inside this capsule is:

options.text: total pressure and outside is static pressure.
dynamic pressure and outside is static pressure.
a very low residual pressure and outside is static pressure.
static pressure and outside is dynamic pressure.

variant.question: What is âunreliable airspeedâ?

options.text: best single-engine rate of climb speed.

over-read in the climb, under-read in the descent.

options.text: position, density, instrument, compressibility, manoeuvre induced.

options.text: which must not be exceeded during a dive.
that may be flown in cruise.
where structural damage will occur if exceeded.

Lower limit VLO and upper limit VLE.

To be as accurate as possible, an airspeed indicator must be calibrated according to the following formula

options.text: Saint-Venant, taking into account the air compressibility.
Bernoulli, taking into account the air compressibility.

Bernoulli, considering the air as an uncompressible fluid.

variant.question: You are flying in IMC and you hear an increasingly stronger aerodynamic noise accompanied by some buffeting and some erroneous speed indications on the PFD. What can you suspect?
